generics.backupReminder: After completely setting up, it is recommended that you use {{prefix}}backup to have a personal backup of your settings.

add.description: Add an RSS feed to the channel this command is used in. Multiple feeds can be added by separation with `>`.

alert.description: Set up user direct messaging for feed warnings/failures.

args.add <user id/mention>: Add a user to direct message.
args.remove <user id/mention>: Remove a user from direct messaging.
args.list: List the current users enabled for direct messaging.

backup.description: Send server profile as a JSON attachment for personal backups.

clone.description: Clone a feed's settings to other feed(s).

compare.description: Add additional positive/negative comparisons on articles for greater control over which articles get sent to your server.

args.(+|-)<property>: The positive or negative article properties to add for comparison. More than one can be added.

date.description: Open a menu to customize how dates are displayed.

args.original: Output the original, untrimmed JSON form instead.

embed.description: Open a menu to customize a feed's embed message. This will replace the normal embed Discord usually sends when a link is posted.

embed.fields.description: Open a menu to customize fields for a feed's embed message. This will replace the normal embed Discord usually sends when a link is posted.

filters.description: Open a menu to add or remove global filters from a feed. Messages that do not have any of the words in any of your filters won't be sent to your Discord.

invite.description: Send the invite links for this bot.

list.description: List all active feeds in server.

args.<channel mention>: Only list the feeds in the mentioned channel.

locale.description: Change the language of commands (if the desired language is supported)

mention.description: Open a menu to add global/filtered subscriptions for roles/users to feeds.

mention.filters.description: Open a menu to manage filters for subscribers so they only get mentioned when its filters pass for any particular delivered article.

move.description: Open a menu to move a feed into another channel.

options.description: Open a menu for miscellaneous feed options.

prefix.description: Change the prefix used for commands from the default ({{prefix}}).

refresh.description: Open a menu to restore the feed link back onto the regular cycle after removal due to consecutively surpassing the fail limit.

remove.description: Open a menu to delete a feed from the channel.

split.description: Open a menu to customize message splitting settings.

stats.description: Show simple stats on bot performance and size.

sub.description: Open a menu to add a role with an active feed subscription to the user. Usable by anyone in server, enabled/disabled by "Manage Roles" permission. Roles *must* be below the bot's role in role order in role settings.

args.simple: Omit the test results and only send the message.

test.description: Opens a menu to send a test message for a random article in a feed, along with the available properties and placeholders for various customizations. You may add `simple` as a parameter to exclude the test details.

text.description: Open a menu to customize a feed's text message.

unsub.description: Open a menu similar to `sub`, except to remove a role. Any role beneath the bot's role order will be removeable.

webhook.description: Open a menu to connect a webhook to a feed to send messages instead.

add.correctSyntax: The correct syntax is {{prefix}}add https://www.some_url_here.com. Multiple links can be added at once, separated by `>`.
add.success: The following feeds have been successfully added to **this channel**
add.successInfo: Articles will be automatically delivered once new articles are found.
add.failedLimit: Feed(s) not listed here could not be added due to the feed limit ({{max}}).
add.failedList: The following feed(s) could not be added

alert.noFeeds: You cannot set up user alerts if you have not added any feeds.
alert.info:
This command adds users for direct messaging (instead of posting such alerts to the feed's channel by default) when there are any warnings or alerts concerning feeds, such as feed limit changes or feed failures. **The user you're adding or removing will be notified.** The correct syntaxes are:

`{{prefix}}alert add <user id/mention>` - Add a user to alerted.
`{{prefix}}alert remove <user id/mention>` - Remove a user currently receiving alerts
`{{prefix}}alert list` - Show all users currently receiving alerts
alert.notFound: The user {{user}} was not found in this server.
alert.alreadyEnabled: That user is already enabled for direct messaging feed warnings/failures in this server.
alert.successDM: At the request of {{member}}, you will now be notified of any warnings/failures of feeds in the server `{{guildName}}` (ID `{{guildID}}`).
alert.success: Successfully enabled user {{member}} for direct messaging feed warnings/failures. The user has been notified of this change.
alert.removedDM: At the request of {{member}}, you will no longer be notified of any warnings or failures of feeds in the server `{{guildName}}` (ID `{{guildID}}`).
alert.removed: Successfully removed user {{member}} from direct messaging feed warnings/failures. The user has been notified of this change.
alert.removeFail: You cannot remove a user that is not currently enabled for feed warning/failure direct messaging alerts.
alert.listEmpty: There are currently no users that will be notified through direct messaging when there are feed warnings/failures in this server.
alert.list: The current list of users below will be notified through direct messaging when there are feed warnings/failures in this server:

backup.noProfile: This server does not have a profile.
backup.noPermission: Unable to send backup due to missing `Attach Files` permission.

clone.copyFrom: Select the source to copy from.
clone.copyTo: Select the destination(s) to copy to.
clone.inputProperties:
Input properties to clone, separated by commas. The properties available for cloning are `{{properties}}`. To clone all these properties, you can just use `all`.

For example, to clone a feed's filters and message, type `filters,message`.
clone.invalidProperties:
Invalid properties found: `{{invalid}}`

Valid properties available for cloning are `{{properties}}`.
clone.confirm:
The following settings for the feed <{{link}}>

`{{cloning}}`

are about to be cloned into the following feeds:
```{{destinations}}```
Note that if a property does not exist in the source feed, the same property in the destination feed(s) will be **deleted**.To confirm this, type `yes`. Otherwise, type `exit` to cancel.
clone.confirmError: You must confirm by typing `yes`, or cancel by typing `exit`. Try again.
clone.success:
The following settings

`{{cloned}}`

for the feed <{{link}}> have been successfully cloned into {{destinationCount}} feed(s).

compare.info:
For greater control over what articles get sent to your server, you can add additional comparisons on article properties. There are "positive" and "negative" comparisons. Each property must be prepended with `+` for positive or `-` for negative.

An example would be `{{prefix}}compare -title`. **This overwrites the current comparison settings.** For more information on what these comparisons mean, please refer to {{infoURL}}.
compare.list:
The current comparisons are currently set for the feed <{{url}}>:

{{values}}
compare.listNone: There are no comparisons set for the feed <{{url}}>.
compare.invalid:
Invalid inputs were found. All comparisons must be prepended with `+` or `-`. The invalid inputs were:

{{errors}}
compare.onlyTitle: Only the negative comparison `-title` is supported at this time.
compare.reset: Comparisons have been successfully reset for the feed <{{url}}>.
compare.success:
The following comparisons have been set for the feed <{{url}}>:

{{added}}

date.noFeeds: You cannot customize the date placeholder if you have not added any feeds.
date.description:
​
Please select an option to customize the {date} placeholder by typing its number, or type `exit` to cancel.​
​
date.optionResetValue: Reset all of the above back to default.
date.successResetAll: All date customizations have been reset back to default.
date.successReset: {{name}} has been reset to the default: `{{value}}`.
date.promptNewLanguage:
Type the abbreviation for a new language now, `reset` to reset back to default, or `exit` to cancel. The available list of languages supported at this time are (separated by commas):

{{localesList}}
date.promptNewDateFormat: Type your new date format now, `reset` to reset back to default, or `exit` to cancel. See <https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/> on how to format a date.
date.promptNewTimezone: Type your new timezone now, `reset` to reset back to default, or `exit` to cancel. See <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones> for a list of timezones under the TZ column.
date.invalidTimezone: `{{input}}` is not a valid timezone. See <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones> for more information. Valid timezones are in the `TZ` column. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.

dump.generatedDump: Dump has been generated. Attempting to attach file, see below.

embed.embedSelectionDescription:
The properties for each embed is shown below. Select one of the embeds by typing the number next to it, or type `exit` to cancel.
​
embed.embedSelectionOptionAddDescription:
A maximum of 10 embeds may be added.
​
embed.currentPropertiesList:
The current embed properties for {{link}} are: 
{{list}}```
embed.invalidColorNumber: The color must be an **number**. See <https://www.shodor.org/stella2java/rgbint.html>. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
embed.invalidColorRange: The color must be a number between 0 and 16777215. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
embed.invalidProperties: The following properties {{invalids}} are invalid. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
embed.removedAllEmbeds: Successfully removed all embeds from feed <{{link}}>.
embed.removedEmbed: Embed has been disabled, and all properties have been removed for <{{link}}>.
embed.title: Title
embed.titleDescription:
Title under Author Title
Accepts placeholders
embed.urlDescription:
Clicking on the Title/Thumbnail will lead to this URL
MUST be a link. Set to the article's url by default
embed.colorDescription:
Sidebar color
MUST be an integer color between 0 and 16777215. See https://www.shodor.org/stella2java/rgbint.html
embed.timestampDescription:
Date that is visually localized to every user
If an invalid timestamp date is detected, timestamp will not be shown
embed.footerIconURLDescription:
Icon to the left of Footer Text
MUST be a link to an image. If Footer Text is unspecified, the Footer Icon will be hidden
Accepts placeholders
embed.thumbnailURLDescription:
Image on the right side
MUST be a link to an image, OR an image placeholder
embed.imageURLDescription:
Image on the bottom
MUST be a link to an image, OR an image placeholder
embed.authorNameDescription:
Name at the top
Accepts placeholders
embed.authorURLDescription:
Clicking on the Author Name will lead to this URL
MUST be a link
embed.authorIconURLDescription:
Icon to the left of Author Name
MUST be a link to an image. If Author Name is unspecified, the Author Icon will be hidden
embed.settingProperty: You are now customizing the **{{property}}**. Type your input now. To reset the property, type `reset`.
embed.settingPropertyTimestamp:
You are now customizing the **timestamp**. Type your input now.

To set the timestamp to the time the article is sent to Discord, type `now`.
To set the timestamp to the time the article was published (if available in the feed), type `article`.
For a custom timestamp, type the text representation of a custom date (see <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/parse>).

To reset the property, type `reset`.
embed.settingPropertyTimestampError: That is not a valid setting. It must be either `now`, `article`, or a valid text representation of a date. Try again.
embed.embedFieldsRemoveNone: There are no embed fields to remove for this feed. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
embed.embedFieldsRemoved: The Field(s) numbered {{numbers}} have been removed from the embed for the feed <{{link}}>.
embed.embedFieldsDescription:
​
Select whether to add or remove a field from this feed's embed. For an example of what a field looks like, see https://i.imgur.com/WSHwmyB.png. Type `exit` to cancel.
​
embed.embedFieldsOptionRemoveDescription: Remove a Field if it exists.
embed.embedFieldsOptionAddRegularDescription: Fields will be stacked on top of each other.
embed.embedFieldsOptionAddInlineDescription: Fields will be placed beside each other whenever possible instead of being stacked.
embed.embedFieldsOptionAddRegularBlankDescript: Contains no title or description. This is used to take up empty space.
embed.embedFieldsOptionRemoveEmbedDescription:
​
Your Fields are listed below, ordered by when they were added. Type the Field's number to remove it, or type multiple Field numbers separateed by commas (`,`). Type `exit` to cancel.
​
embed.embedFieldsAddedBlank: An blank Field has been added to the embed for the feed <{{link}}>.
embed.embedFieldsAddedBlankInline: An inline blank Field has been added to the embed for the feed <{{link}}>.
embed.embedFieldsSettingPrompt: Set your Field settings now. The **first line will be the Field title**, and **any new lines after the first will be the Field description**. If there is no content after the first line, then it will be an empty description. Type `exit` to cancel.
embed.embedFieldsSettingTitleLong: Titles cannot exceed 256 characters. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
embed.embedFieldsSettingValueLong: Field values cannot exceed 1024 characters. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
embed.embedFieldsAdded:
A new{{type}} Field has been added to the embed with the following details:

**Title**
```
{{name}}
```
**Value**
```
{{value}}
```
for the feed {{link}}.

filters.optionAddFiltersDescription: Add new filter(s) to a specific category in a feed.
filters.optionListFiltersDescription: List all filters in all categories, if any.
filters.optionSendArticleDescription: Send a randomly chosen article that passes current filter(s) if they exist.
filters.removedAllSuccess: All feed filters have been successfully removed from <{{link}}>.
filters.noFilters: There are no filters assigned to {{link}}.
filters.noFiltersTryAgain: There are no filters assigned to {{link}}. Select another option, or type `exit` to cancel.
filters.connectionFailureLimit: Unable to send article since failure limit has been reached (see {{prefix}}list for more information). Select another option, or type `exit` to cancel.
filters.noArticlesPassed: No articles were able to pass this feed's filters.

help.controlPanelLink: Be sure to check out your control panel at {{url}} for easy feed management!
help.description: Arguments for commands are added after the command. For example: `{{prefix}}test simple`. Do not include `<` or `>` in the arguments.
help.support: Support can be found at https://discord.gg/pudv7Rx

invite.text:
Invite with Role - <https://discordapp.com/oauth2/authorize?client_id={{id}}&scope=bot&permissions=19456>

Invite without Role - <https://discordapp.com/oauth2/authorize?client_id={{id}}&scope=bot>

list.noFeedsChannel: There are no feeds in the channel {{channel}}.
list.failAlert:
**Attention!** Feeds that have reached {{failLimit}} connection failure limit have been detected. They will no longer be retried until the bot instance is restarted. Please either remove, or use **{{prefix}}refresh** to try to reset its status.​
​

locale.helpText:
To change the interface language of commands, type the locale name after `{{prefix}}locale`. Locales are added through volunteer-sourced translations. Supported locales are:

`{{localeList}}`
locale.resetNone: This server already has no locale set.
locale.resetNoDefault: `{{locale}}` is the default locale. Use `{{prefix}}locale reset` to restore the default instead.
locale.resetSuccess: Locale has been successfully reset back to `{{locale}}`.
locale.setSuccess: Locale has successfully been changed to `{{locale}}`.
locale.setNone:
`{{locale}}` is not a supported locale. Supported locales are:

`{{localeList}}`

mention.noFeeds: Cannot add mention customizations without any active feeds.
mention.description:
Adding a subscription for a user or role will automatically add their mentions in the `{subscribers}` placeholder. If the subscriber is a role, then the role will be added to the list of eligible roles for role mention toggling, and also for the commands {{prefix}}sub/unsub.

Select an option by typing its number, or type `exit` to cancel.​
​
mention.optionAddSubscriber: Add a subscriber to a feed
mention.optionAddSubscriberDescription: Mentions a role/user for all delivered articles of this feed.
mention.optionRemoveSubscriber: Remove a subscriber from a feed
mention.optionRemoveSubscriberDescription: Remove a subscribed role/user from a feed
mention.optionRemoveAllSubscribers: Remove all subscribers of a feed
mention.optionRemoveAllSubscribersDescription: Remove all role/user subscribers from a feed
mention.promptUserOrRole: Mention a role/user that is subscribed to the feed <{{link}}> in channel {{channel}} to manage its filters.
mention.listSubscribersDescription: Below are the subscribers of the feed <{{link}}> in channel {{channel}}.
mention.listSubscribersNone: There are no subscribers for the feed <{{link}}> in channel {{channel}}.
mention.removeAllSubscribersSuccess: All subscribers have been successfully removed from feed <{{link}}>.
mention.addSubscriberExists: Unable to add subscriber. {{type}} {{mention}} is already subscribed to this feed.
mention.notFeedSubscriber: This role or user is not subscribed to the feed <{{link}}>. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
mention.removeSubscriberSuccess: Successfully removed the subscriber {{mention}} from the feed <{{link}}>.
mention.removeAnySubscriberNone: There are no subscribers to remove from the feed <{{link}}>.
mention.invalidRoleOrUser: That is not a valid role or user. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.

filters.title: Subscriber Filters Customization
filters.description:
**Feed URL:** {{link}}

Adding filters to a subscriber will cause it to only get mentioned within the `{suscribers}` placeholder of an article if its filters pass the article.
filters.notSubscriber: This role or user is not a subscriber. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
filters.optionRemoveAllFilters: Remove all filters from a subscriber
filters.optionListFilters: List all filters of a subscriber
filters.listNoFilters: There are no filters assigned to {{subscriber}} for the feed <{{link}}>.
filters.removedAllFilters: Successfully removed all filters from subscriber {{subscriber}} for feed <{{link}}>

text.prompt:
The current text for {{link}} is: 
{{currentMsg}}
Type your new customized text now, type `reset` to use the default text, or type `exit` to cancel. 

Remember that you can use the placeholders `{title}`, `{description}`, `{link}`, and etc. `{empty}` will create an empty message, but only if an embed is used. Regular formatting such as **bold** and etc. is also available. To find other placeholders, type `exit` then `{{prefix}}test`.
text.noEmpty: You cannot have empty text if there is no embed used for this feed. Try again.
text.noSetText: None has been set. Currently using default text below:
text.resetSuccess: Text has been reset and using default text for feed {{link}}:
text.noSubscriptionsPlaceholder: Note that because there is no `{subscriptions}`, whatever subscriptions you add through {{prefix}}mention will *not* appear in this feed's article text.
text.reminder: You may use `{{prefix}}test` to see your new text format.

move.prompt: Mention the channel to move the feed(s) to, or type `this` for this channel.
move.invalidChannel: That is not a valid channel. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
move.alreadyInChannel: The feed is already in that channel.
move.linkAlreadyExists: A feed with this link already exists in that channel.
move.meMissingPermission: I am missing **Read Messages** or **Send Messages** permission in <#{{id}}>.
move.meMissingEmbedLinks: I am missing **Embed Links** permission in the <#{{id}}>. To bypass this permission, you can reset this feed's embed via the embed command.
move.youMissingPermission: You are missing **Read Messages**, **Send Messages**, or **Manage Channel** permission in <#{{id}}>.

options.selectOption:
​
Please select an option by typing its number, or type `exit` to cancel.​
​
options.titleChecksToggle: Toggle Title Checks for a feed
options.titleChecksDescription: Title checks will ensure no article with the same title as a previous one will be sent for a specific feed.
options.imagePreviewsToggle: Toggle Image Link Previews for a feed's placeholders
options.imagePreviewsDescription: Toggle automatic Discord image link embedded previews for image links found inside placeholders such as {description}.
options.imageLinksExistenceToggle: Toggle Image Links Existence for a feed's placeholders
options.imageLinksExistenceDescription: Remove image links found inside placeholders such as {description}. If disabled, all image `src` links in such placeholders will be removed.
options.dateChecksToggle: Toggle Date Checks for a feed
options.dateChecksDescription: Date checking ensures that articles that are {{cycleMaxAge}} day(s) old or has invalid/no pubdates are't sent.
options.tableFormattingToggle: Toggle Table Formatting for a feed
options.tableFormattingDescription: If table formatting is enabled, they should be enclosed in code blocks to ensure uniform spacing.
options.directSubscribersToggle: Toggle direct subscriptions for a feed
options.directSubscribersDescription: Allows users to directly add themselves as a subscriber to the feed `{subscribers}` placeholder. This is an alternative to letting users add roles to themselves.

prefix.helpText: You must specify a prefix 4 characters or less as the first argument to set a custom prefix, or `reset` to reset the prefix to default if a custom prefix is already set.
prefix.resetNone: You have no custom prefix to reset.
prefix.resetSuccess: Commands prefix has been reset back to the default ({{prefix}}).
prefix.requirements: Commands prefix length must be less than 5 characters with no spaces.
prefix.cannotUseDefault: Cannot use this commands prefix because it is already the default prefix.

refresh.noFailLimit: No failure limit has been set.
refresh.noFailedFeeds: There are no failed feeds to refresh.
refresh.processing: Processing requests for refresh. This may take a while. Please wait...
refresh.success: The following links have successfully been refreshed:
refresh.failed: The following links failed to refresh:

split.optionEnableDescription: Message splitting splits a message that exceeds the Discord character limit into multiple messages instead.
split.optionSetSplitCharDescription: Specify the character that the message should split according to.
split.optionSetPrependCharDescription: Specify the character that every message except the first should be prepended (added before) with.
split.optionSetAppendCharDescription: Specify the character that every message except the last should be appended (added after) with.
split.optionSetMaxLengthDescription: Specify the maximum length a single message should have.
split.promptSplitChar: Type a split character now, `reset` to reset, or `exit` to cancel.
split.promptPrependChar: Type a prepend character now, `reset` to reset, or `exit` to cancel.
split.promptAppendChar: Type an append character now, `reset` to reset, or `exit` to cancel.
split.promptMaxLen: Type the max length a single message should have now, `reset` to reset, or `exit` to cancel. **Must be a number >= 500 and <= 1950.**
split.setSplitCharDefault: That is already the default character. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel and leave it at default.
split.setSplitChar: The split character for the feed <{{link}}> has been set to `{{content}}`.
split.setPrependChar: The prepend character for the feed <{{link}}> has been set to `{{content}}`.
split.setAppendChar: The append character for the feed <{{link}}> has been set to `{{content}}`.
split.setMaxLen: The max length for a single message for the feed <{{link}}> has been set to `{{num}}`.
split.setInvalidMaxLen: That is not a valid number >= 500 and <= 1950. Try again.
split.resetSplitChar: The split character for the feed <{{link}}> has been reset to `\n`.
split.resetPrependChar: The prepend character for the feed <{{link}}> has been reset to be nothing.
split.resetAppendChar: The append character for the feed <{{link}}> has been reset to be nothing.
split.resetMaxLen: The max length for a single message for the feed <{{link}}> has been reset to be `1950`.
split.disabledSuccess: Message splitting is now disabled for feed <{{link}}>.

test.failed: Unable to grab a random article because this feed's current status is failed. See {{prefix}}list for more information.
test.noArticles: There are no articles in this feed to send.

webhook.existingFound: An existing webhook was found ({{webhookMention}}). You may type `{remove}` to disconnect the existing webhook, or continue and your new setting will overwrite the existing one.
webhook.prompt:
Type the name of the webhook in this channel you wish to use (case sensitive), or type `exit` to cancel.

To use a different name or avatar url of the webhook when articles are sent for this particular feed, add parameters `--name="my new name here"` or `--avatar="http://website.com/image.jpg"`. Placeholders are supported.
webhook.notFound: No such webhook named "{{name}}" found for this channel. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
webhook.tooLong: Webhook name must be between 2 and 32 characters. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
webhook.noPermission: I must have Manage Webhooks permission in this channel in order to work. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
webhook.removeSuccess: Successfully removed webhook from the feed <{{link}}>.
webhook.connected: I am now connected to {{clientMention}}, and will send feed articles for <{{link}}>!
webhook.missingChannel: The channel <#{{channelID}}> for the feed <{{link}}> is missing. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.

sub.title: Self-Subscription Addition
sub.description: You may be mentioned whenever a new article comes in for a particular feed by selecting an option below.
sub.optionAddRole: I want to add a mentioned role to myself
sub.optionAddRoleDescription: You may add a role that is subscribed to a feed so that you'll be mentioned via role.
sub.optionAddMe: I want to be directly mentioned for a feed
sub.optionAddMeDescription: You may directly add yourself as a subscriber to a feed so that you'll be directly mentioned. **This is only possible if this feature is enabled for this server.**
sub.optionSubscribedFeedsDescription: Show all the feeds that you are currently being mentioned in (whether they're role mentions or direct mentions)
sub.subscribedFeedsList: Below is the list of feeds that you are subscribed to.
sub.noSubscribedFeedsList: You are not being mentioned in any feeds.
sub.noEligible: There are either no feeds with subscribed roles, or no eligible subscribed roles that can be self-added.
sub.invalidRole: That is an invalid role. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
sub.listInputRole: Above is the list of feeds, their channels, and eligible roles that you may add to yourself. Type the role name to add the role to yourself, or type `exit` to cancel.
sub.addSuccess: You now have the role `{{name}}`, subscribed to:
sub.directSubscribeExists: Unable to directly subscribe to feed <{{link}}>. You are already subscribed to it.
sub.directSubscribeSuccess: You are now directly subscribed to the feed <{{link}}>.
sub.alreadyHaveRole: You already have this role. Try another role name, or type `exit` to cancel.
sub.directSubscriberDisabled: The feed <{{link}}> in {{channel}} does not allow direct subscribers. It must be enabled in the `{{prefix}}options` command. Try another feed, or type `exit` to cancel.

unsub.optionRemoveRole: I want to remove a mentioned role from myself
unsub.optionRemoveRoleDescription: Remove a role from yourself that is currently mentioned within a feed
unsub.optionRemoveMyself: I want to remove a mention of myself from a feed
unsub.optionRemoveMyselfDescription: Remove a direct mention of yourself within a feed
unsub.optionRemoveAll: I want to remove all mentions of me from all feeds
unsub.optionRemoveAllDescription: Remove all direct mentions and mentioned roles within feeds that include you
unsub.noEligibleRoles: There are no eligible roles to be removed from you. Select a different option, or type `exit` to cancel.
unsub.noEligibleDirect: You are not directly mentioned in any feeds. Select a different option, or type `exit` to cancel.
unsub.invalidRole: That is not a valid role to remove. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
unsub.title: Self-Subscription Removal
unsub.directRemoveList: Below are all the feeds you are directly mentioned in.
unsub.listInputRole: Above is the list of feeds, their channels, and eligible roles that you may remove from yourself. Type the role name to remove it, or type `exit` to cancel.
unsub.roleRemoveSuccess: You no longer have the role {{role}}.
unsub.directRemoveSuccess: You will now no longer be directly mentioned for the feed <{{link}}>.
unsub.removeAllSuccess: You will now no longer be directly mentioned or mentioned through roles for any feed.

filters.title: Title
filters.author: Author
filters.categoryDescription:
Below is the list of filter categories you may add filters to. Type the filter category for which you would like you add a filter to, or type `exit` to cancel. To type a filter category that's not listed here but is in the raw dump, start it with `raw:`. For other unlisted filter categories, start it with `other:`.​
​
filters.invalidCategory: That is not a valid filter category. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
filters.promptAdd:
Type the filter word/phrase you would like to add in the category `{{type}}` by typing it, type multiple word/phrases on different lines to add more than one, or type `exit` to cancel. The following can be added in front of a search term to change its behavior:


`~` - Broad filter modifier to trigger even if the term is found embedded inside words/phrases.
`!` - NOT filter modifier to do the opposite of a normal search term. Can be added in front of any term, including one with broad filter mod.
`\` - Escape symbol added before modifiers to interpret them as regular characters and not modifiers.


Filters will be applied as **case insensitive** to feeds. Because of this, all input will be converted to be lowercase.
filters.addSuccess: The following filter(s) have been successfully added for the filter category
filters.addFailed: The following filter(s) could not be added because they already exist
filters.testFiltersSubscriber: You may test your filters on random articles via `{{prefix}}test` and see what articles will mention this subscriber.
filters.testFilters: You may test random articles with `{{prefix}}test` to see what articles pass your filters, or specifically send filtered articles with `{{prefix}}filters` option 5.
filters.removeFilterConfirm: Confirm the filter word/phrase you would like to remove in the category `{{category}}` by typing one or multiple word/phrases separated by new lines (case sensitive).
filters.removeFilterInvalid: That is not a valid filter to remove from `{{category}}`. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
filters.removeSuccess: The following filter(s) have been successfully removed from the filter category
filters.removeFailedNoExist: The following filter(s) were unable to be deleted because they do not exist
filters.removeNone: There are no filters to remove for <{{link}}>.
filters.regexExists: Error: Filters cannot be modified through commands when a regex filter string exists for this filter category ({{category}}). Manually remove the regex string to be able to edit this filter category through commands again.

MenuUtils.permissionWarning: WARNING: Missing "Add Reactions" or "Read Message History" permissions in this channel. Because this menu has more than {{maxPerPage}} options, it will not function properly without the right permissions
MenuUtils.closedInactivity: I have closed the menu due to inactivity.

FeedSelector.noFeeds: This server does not have any feeds.
FeedSelector.noFeedsInChannel: There are no feeds assigned to this channel.
FeedSelector.prompt: Choose a feed to from this channel by typing the number to execute your requested action on.
FeedSelector.multiSelect: You may select multiple feeds by separation with commas (for example `1,3,8`).

MenuOptionError.message: That is not a valid choice. Try again, or type `exit` to cancel.
